programme.title: The Big Wedding
Vjenčanje godine
programme.desc: The Big Wedding: Directed by Justin Zackham. With Robert De Niro, Katherine Heigl, Diane Keaton, Amanda Seyfried. A long-divorced couple fakes being married as their family unites for a wedding." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt1931435/","name":"The Big Wedding","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTcwODUwMjg2Ml5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwMTc2NzkxOA@@._V1_.jpg","contentRating":"R","genre":["Comedy","Drama","Romance"],"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000134/","name":"Robert De Niro"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000473/","name":"Diane Keaton"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001337/","name":"Katherine Heigl"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0951698/","name":"Justin Zackham"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0188112/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0002572/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0951698/","name":"Justin Zackham"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0111379/","name":"Jean-Stéphane Bron"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0837141/","name":"Karine Sudan"}],"trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Version 2","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2079761945","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjExNDc2Mzk1N15BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwMDk0MzEzOQ@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjExNDc2Mzk1N15BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwMDk0MzEzOQ@@._V1_.jpg","description":"To the amusement of their adult children and friends, long divorced couple Don and Ellie Griffin are once again forced to play the happy couple for the sake of their adopted son's wedding after his ultra conservative biological mother unexpectedly decides to fly halfway across the world to attend. With all of the wedding guests looking on, the Griffins are hilariously forced to confront their past, present and future - and hopefully avoid killing each other in the process. "},"datePublished":"2013-04-26","description":"A long-divorced couple fakes being married as their family unites for a wedding.","keywords":"wedding,divorce,family relationships,farce,adoption","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1931435/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"crossroadsxdemon"},"dateCreated":"2013-04-30","inLanguage":"English","name":"Awkward with a capital A","reviewBody":"Over all the movie was a bit of a disappointment even though I've been looking forward to seeing it for quite some time (Not for the big A- list case either), Rather I was looking forward to seeing the Talents of Ben Barnes back on the big screen. I wasn't disappointed in that regard. His portrayal of Alejandro was brilliant, his American accent was exact and his Spanish was impressive as well. I thought Al and Missy were adorable, but the movie itself had way too much going on. Just when you thought the story line couldn't get any crazier something stupider happened and by the end it was hard to keep everything that was going on straight. It had endearing and sweet family moments that were really it's only saving grace. If you had cut out half the random story lines and the random awkward sexual parts that...for the record did not add to the plot line, it would have been a great movie but as usual a potentially good film is ruined with crude comedy. With all of the wedding guests looking on, the Griffins are hilariously forced to confront their past, present and future - and hopefully avoid killing each other in the process. ","datePublished":"2013-04-26","description":"A long-divorced couple fakes being married as their family unites for a wedding.","keywords":"wedding,divorce,family relationships,farce,adoption","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1931435/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"crossroadsxdemon","dateCreated":"2013-04-30","inLanguage":"English","name":"Awkward with a capital A","reviewBody":"Over all the movie was a bit of a disappointment even though I've been looking forward to seeing it for quite some time (Not for the big A- list case either), Rather I was looking forward to seeing the Talents of Ben Barnes back on the big screen. I wasn't disappointed in that regard. His portrayal of Alejandro was brilliant, his American accent was exact and his Spanish was impressive as well. I thought Al and Missy were adorable, but the movie itself had way too much going on. Just when you thought the story line couldn't get any crazier something stupider happened and by the end it was hard to keep everything that was going on straight. It had endearing and sweet family moments that were really it's only saving grace. If you had cut out half the random story lines and the random awkward sexual parts that...for the record did not add to the plot line, it would have been a great movie but as usual a potentially good film is ruined with crude comedy. That being said some of the story lines that had been supplemented by crude comedy were amusing story lines but were sort of ruined.","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":6,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":47867,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.6,"duration":"PT1H30M"</script><metacontent="

programme.desc:
Paranoia: Directed by Robert Luketic. With Liam Hemsworth, Gary Oldman, Amber Heard, Harrison Ford. An entry-level employee at a powerful corporation finds himself occupying a corner office, but at a dangerous price: he must spy on his boss's old mentor to secure for him a multi-billion dollar advantage." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt1413495/","name":"Paranoia","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTUyNjYwMTYwM15BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwNDA4NTc2OQ@@._V1_.jpg","contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Drama","Thriller"],"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2955013/","name":"Liam Hemsworth"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000198/","name":"Gary Oldman"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000148/","name":"Harrison Ford"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0525659/","name":"Robert Luketic"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0142678/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0336601/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0317576/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0355699/","name":"Jason Hall"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1633356/","name":"Barry L. Levy"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0277511/","name":"Joseph Finder"}],"trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Trailer #1","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi3075778073","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNTAyODQ4NTc5NV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMTQ4NjkyMzE@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNTAyODQ4NTc5NV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMTQ4NjkyMzE@._V1_.jpg","description":"The two most powerful tech billionaires in the world are bitter rivals with a complicated past. When a young new superstar, seduced by unlimited wealth and power falls between them, he becomes trapped in the middle of their life-and-death game of corporate espionage.
"},"datePublished":"2013-08-16","description":"An entry-level employee at a powerful corporation finds himself occupying a corner office, but at a dangerous price: he must spy on his boss's old mentor to secure for him a multi-billion dollar advantage.","keywords":"spying,thumbprint,traffic,man wears a swimsuit,man wrapped in a towel","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1413495/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"blufrog49"},"dateCreated":"2013-08-24","inLanguage":"English","name":"Kinda boring","reviewBody":"With a title like "Paranoia," I expected suspicion, suspense, maybe even a cool chase scene, but this movie not only lacks the characteristics its title suggests, but is really devoid of any depth. It seems to be a vehicle to see Liam Hemsworth shirtless as much as possible, as well as in some gorgeous suits.

Amid a lot of techie razzle-dazzle, the plot is rather thin and predictable and there is absolutely NO character development, except a small amount for Richard Dreyfuss, who seems to be the most interesting character in the movie. It was nice to see him in this role.

Harrison Ford doesn't look good with a shaved head. Reminded me of Mr. Magoo without the glasses.

Not a bad movie, but certainly not a thriller and definitely forgettable","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":4}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":35416,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.7},"duration":"PT1H46M"}</script><metacontent="

Lovelace: Život porno kraljice
programme.desc:
Lovelace: Directed by Rob Epstein, Jeffrey Friedman. With Amanda Seyfried, Peter Sarsgaard, Sharon Stone, Robert Patrick. The story of Linda Lovelace, who is used and abused by the porn industry at the behest of her coercive husband before taking control of her life." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt1426329/","name":"Lovelace","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOTM0Mzc2MjgyN15BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwOTIzNDQ4OQ@@._V1_.jpg","contentRating":"R","genre":["Biography","Drama"],"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1086543/","name":"Amanda Seyfried"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0765597/","name":"Peter Sarsgaard"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000232/","name":"Sharon Stone"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0258531/","name":"Rob Epstein"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0295243/","name":"Jeffrey Friedman"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0002572/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0147213/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0034249/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1358354/","name":"Andy Bellin"}],"trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Theatrical Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1468180761","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTc5MjQ5MDM1M15BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwMDI2NzI4OQ@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTc5MjQ5MDM1M15BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwMDI2NzI4OQ@@._V1_.jpg","description":"The story of Linda Lovelace, who is used and abused by the porn industry at the behest of her coercive husband, before taking control of her life. "},"datePublished":"2013-08-08","description":"The story of Linda Lovelace, who is used and abused by the porn industry at the behest of her coercive husband before taking control of her life.","keywords":"porn industry,clitoris,sex toy,fellatio,deep throat","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1426329/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"Hey_Sweden"},"dateCreated":"2019-01-31","inLanguage":"English","name":"A respectable, if not great, rendition of Lovelaces' sad tale.","reviewBody":"Directed by the team of Rob Epstein and Jeffrey Friedman, "Lovelace" is a short and not-so-sweet Hollywoodization of the real-life story of Linda Boreman, a.k.a. adult movie sensation Linda Lovelace. At 21 years old, she's living with her uptight parents (Robert Patrick and an unrecognizable Sharon Stone) when she meets charming stranger Chuck Traynor (Peter Sarsgaard). He's actually a pretty sleazy guy who finagles her into a job in porn films, specifically the landmark effort "Deep Throat". He also turns out to be an abusive monster, whose atrocities were recounted by Linda in her book "Ordeal".

With these Hollywood versions of such stories, it's always advisable to take them with a grain of salt. For one thing, even this viewer, who's not particularly knowledgeable about the adult film industry, knows full well that Linda did a fair bit more than just that one classic. "Lovelace" the movie actually leaves out some things to focus on limited story threads. The filmmakers try to be clever with their narrative by jumping back and forth in time, but this could only be confusing for some in the audience.

It's worth a look just to watch Epstein, Friedman, and company give us a look into the porn filmmaking scene in the 1970s. Time and place are well captured, but the soundtrack tends to get annoying; we don't need these constant reminders of when the story largely takes place. The film IS very slick, and makes its points in approximately an hour and a half, so it doesn't overstay its welcome.

The strength lies in the talents of the ensemble cast. Amanda Seyfried is appealing as the not-so-innocent but still endearing Linda, while Sarsgaard, no stranger to creepy roles, is convincing as the slime ball husband. Stone gives a creditable performance in a severely deglamourized role, and Adam Brody is a hoot as porn legend Harry Reems. James Franco is charisma-free and miscast as Hugh Hefner.

There is enough compelling material here for one to realize that a more in-depth recounting of the tale would be appreciated.

Six out of 10.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":6}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":39144,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.2},"duration":"PT1H33M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Foxcatcher
Rvanje sa ludilom
programme.desc: Directed by Bennett Miller. With Steve Carell, Channing Tatum, Mark Ruffalo, Vanessa Redgrave. U.S. Olympic wrestling champions and brothers Mark Schultz and Dave Schultz join "Team Foxcatcher", led by eccentric multi-millionaire John du Pont, as they train for the 1988 Olympic Games in Seoul, South Korea, but John's self-destructive behavior threatens to consume them all.

programme.title: Foxcatcher
Rvanje sa ludilom
programme.desc:
Foxcatcher: Directed by Bennett Miller. With Steve Carell, Channing Tatum, Mark Ruffalo, Sienna Miller. U.S. Olympic wrestling champions and brothers Mark Schultz and Dave Schultz join "Team Foxcatcher", led by eccentric multi-millionaire John du Pont, as they train for the 1988 Olympic Games in Seoul, South Korea, but John's self-destructive behavior threatens to consume them all." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt1100089/","name":"Foxcatcher","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTQ2MjQxNjYxOV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMzIwODUxMzE@._V1_.jpg","contentRating":"R","genre":["Biography","Drama","History"],"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0136797/","name":"Steve Carell"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1475594/","name":"Channing Tatum"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0749263/","name":"Mark Ruffalo"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0587955/","name":"Bennett Miller"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0323215/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0754971/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0190175/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0296861/","name":"E. Max Frye"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001246/","name":"Dan Futterman"}],"trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"UK TV Spot","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi230469145","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTk2MjA3ODM1OV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwNDc2NTY2MzE@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTk2MjA3ODM1OV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwNDc2NTY2MzE@._V1_.jpg","description":"Foxcatcher tells the fascinating true story of corruption and the struggle for power between Olympic gold medal-winning brothers and an eccentric millionaire."},"datePublished":"2015-01-16","description":"U.S. Olympic wrestling champions and brothers Mark Schultz and Dave Schultz join "Team Foxcatcher", led by eccentric multi-millionaire John du Pont, as they train for the 1988 Olympic Games in Seoul, South Korea, but John's self-dest","keywords":"domination,wrestler,pennsylvania,upper class,1980s","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1100089/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"left-of-center"},"dateCreated":"2015-04-01","inLanguage":"English","name":"Missing a True Emotional Core","reviewBody":"I'm usually on the same page as movie critics and fans when it comes to awards season flicks. But, I just don't get the massive acclaim for "Foxcatcher", Bennett Miller's based-on-a-true-story drama about the fractured relationships between two Olympic wrestling brothers, Mark and Dave Schultz (Channing Tatum and Mark Ruffalo), and their mentally disturbed benefactor, John du Pont (Steve Carell). Do I think it's a terrible film? I won't go that far. But, nothing about it emotionally moved me or made me think too much. I think it's just one of those movies that come off as so "serious" that the knee-jerk reaction is praise.

Here's my main problem: the storytelling and characters are so hollow. I don't know if this was Miller's point but there's a way to depict emptiness and hollowness without the film feeling empty and hollow itself. Many people describe this as a "slow burn" that requires patience and concentration from a viewer. I have plenty of both and tend to usually enjoy slower films. But, it's not the slowness that some people are reacting to. It's the deadness at the center.

We get no deep insight into any of the characters, except for John in rare moments, besides what they say superficially. What was it that really ruined the relationship between Mark and John? Jealousy, insecurity, betrayal, suppressed homoeroticism? What did Dave really think of John? And why exactly did Mark spiral so dramatically? 

Now, I do appreciate ambiguity in characters and film very much. Not everything has to be obvious, cut-and-dry. But, if you're going to make the characters an enigma, at least give us more to work with to be able to figure them out. Instead, "Foxcatcher" disappointingly stays on the surface, making us guess way too much instead of diving deep into these people, who, given the fact that they're real, leave plenty of room to explore.

Because of this, the tragic ending left me pretty cold. John is such an empty shell throughout that we're never fully let into his inner world. We never get to completely understand his insanity. We're always on the outside of this character, looking in. As a result, his actions just feel disconnected and unexplainable. And the fact that the film ends so abruptly, without making us fully feel the impact of this horrible event, makes it even odder to digest.

Luckily, the performances of Carell and Ruffalo save the show and made it somewhat watchable. Carell joins the lengthy list of hilarious comedians capable of moving dramatic work. Known to audiences as a lovable, heart-warming goofball, he totally transforms and channels a still, unsettling intensity. I squirmed watching some of his scenes, as he was so palpably awkward and in pain, while making the aloof way the character was written work. Ruffalo is a great character actor yet always brings his own brand of sweetness and groundedness to every role. He has a way of making his characters seem totally real and recognizable. Here, he stands out as the most relatable, appealing member of the bunch. Their Oscar nominations were well-deserved.

Now, as far as Tatum goes, I did not see the brilliant, career-changing performance many were raving about. He was more or less his same one-note, depthless self, except he was given a few ridiculously showy scenes here. But, he still underwhelmed me. This part is really the central role and a truly gifted actor could've done so much with it. Mark is naive, ambitious, intense, obsessive, immature, and vulnerable. Yet, in Tatum's hands, who seems to be under the impression that stone-faced staring is great acting, he generally just comes off as dim and foolish, missing all of the emotional layers that should've been there (which could be another reason why it just failed to resonate with me).

If I had to recommend this, it'd only be for Carell and Ruffalo, who both act circles around Tatum. I can understand what Miller was trying to do with the film. Yet, I don't feel compelled to revisit.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":5}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":136196,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7},"duration":"PT2H14M"}</script><metacontent="

And the fact that the film ends so abruptly, without making us fully feel the impact of this horrible event, makes it even odder to digest.

Luckily, the performances of Carell and Ruffalo save the show and made it somewhat watchable. Carell joins the lengthy list of hilarious comedians capable of moving dramatic work. Known to audiences as a lovable, heart-warming goofball, he totally transforms and channels a still, unsettling intensity. I squirmed watching some of his scenes, as he was so palpably awkward and in pain, while making the aloof way the character was written work. Ruffalo is a great character actor yet always brings his own brand of sweetness and groundedness to every role. He has a way of making his characters seem totally real and recognizable. Here, he stands out as the most relatable, appealing member of the bunch. Their Oscar nominations were well-deserved.

Now, as far as Tatum goes, I did not see the brilliant, career-changing performance many were raving about. He was more or less his same one-note, depthless self, except he was given a few ridiculously showy scenes here. But, he still underwhelmed me. This part is really the central role and a truly gifted actor could've done so much with it. Mark is naive, ambitious, intense, obsessive, immature, and vulnerable. Yet, in Tatum's hands, who seems to be under the impression that stone-faced staring is great acting, he generally just comes off as dim and foolish, missing all of the emotional layers that should've been there (which could be another reason why it just failed to resonate with me).

If I had to recommend this, it'd only be for Carell and Ruffalo, who both act circles around Tatum. I can understand what Miller was trying to do with the film. Yet, I don't feel compelled to revisit.","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":5,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":136196,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7,"duration":"PT2H14M"</script><metacontent="

But they learn that money can't buy happiness.","keywords":"based on tv series,stone age,reboot of series,product placement,based on cartoon","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0109813/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"lukem-52760"},"dateCreated":"2019-06-30","inLanguage":"English","name":"GREAT PURE 90'S MAGICAL INNOCENT FUN.","reviewBody":"I grew up in the 90's & it was a great time & so much better than today 2019,it seemed such a fun,innocent & happier time & a great time for feelgood family films such as Casper (1995),SpaceJam (1997),Jumanji (1995),Flubber (1998),Small Soldiers (1998),ConeHeads (1993) & many many more that came out during that Awesome time. The Flintstones was a huge summertime blockbuster that's full of fun & Happy times mixed into a colourful live-action version of the classic cartoon.

I loved this movie when it came (i still do) & i remember so much merchandise & promotion for this,it was everywhere. I had action figures & fridge magnets & cups & all sorts from the movie!!! The Flintstones was huge in 1994!!! Legendary Steven Spielberg was producer so you knew the effort & budget that went into this project was huge along with the nice Spielberg feel of family & sense of wonder.

John Goodman was PERFECT as Fred Flintstone,he gave a fully fun & often touching performance & is a joy to watch. He really brought the character to life but kept the silly funny feel of fred. Legendary comic great Rick Moranis was also perfect as freds best buddy Barney Rubble & also plays his role with fun & Heart. The whole cast is great & seemed to all be having so much fun!!! Rosie O'Donnell was good fun as Betty Rubble & Elizabeth Perkins is great as Wilma Flintstone.

The music is lovely & full of Nostalgia, the production design & sets are absolutely beautiful,they created such a stunningly beautiful world for the Flintstones & it's gorgeous!!!

The Flintstones is harmless,Happy & feelgood fun for the whole family & is a great film from my childhood growing up so i hold a special little spot in my heart for this lovely little comedy.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":77117,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":4.9},"duration":"PT1H31M"}</script><metacontent="

A mother and daughter con team seduce and scam wealthy men." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0125022/","name":"Heartbreakers","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTQ2NjE3NjQzOF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwMDIwOTA0NA@@._V1_.jpg","contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Comedy","Crime","Romance"],"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000244/","name":"Sigourney Weaver"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001349/","name":"Jennifer Love Hewitt"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000432/","name":"Gene Hackman"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0592400/","name":"David Mirkin"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0022730/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0007143/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0242743/","name":"Robert Dunn"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0345488/","name":"Paul Guay"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0563397/","name":"Stephen Mazur"}],"trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Official Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2470559257","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZDNhM2Y4YmYtZmU2ZC00MmYwLWFhNTctOTVmYzNhOTExNTBhXkEyXkFqcGdeQXN3aWZ0dw@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZDNhM2Y4YmYtZmU2ZC00MmYwLWFhNTctOTVmYzNhOTExNTBhXkEyXkFqcGdeQXN3aWZ0dw@@._V1_.jpg","description":"A mother and daughter con team seduce and scam wealthy men."},"datePublished":"2001-03-23","description":"A mother and daughter con team seduce and scam wealthy men.","keywords":"decolletage,short dress,revolver,female criminal,femme fatale","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0125022/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"FlickJunkie-2"},"dateCreated":"2001-11-04","inLanguage":"English","name":"Screwball comedy; Hackman steals the show","reviewBody":"This screwball comedy brings together some great dramatic actors in unaccustomed comedic roles. The results are mixed (but mostly good), with some terrific slapstick and some pure drivel. Maxine (Sigourney Weaver) and Paige (Jennifer Love Hewitt) are two very slick con artists who find rich patsies and marry them, only to divorce them for big settlements after enticing them into indiscretions. When they get nabbed by the IRS for not paying their taxes, they must score one more time to climb out of their financial mess. The target is chain smoking billionaire William B. Tensy (Gene Hackman) who is dying before our eyes of lung disease. The only question is whether Maxine can get him to propose before he keels over. Meanwhile, Paige is running her own scam on Jack (Jason Lee) who owns a bar resting on prime real estate worth $3 Million.

It is mostly pratfall humor, with lots of sight gags and general nuttiness, which is often uproariously funny. The whole idea that the diminutive Paige could have been spawned from the Amazonian Maxine is implied comedy at its finest, leading us to conclude that Paige's father could only have been a midget.

Gene Hackman completely steals the show as the wheezy billionaire. Hackman, who is one of our national treasures as a dramatic actor, shows magnificent range, and he turns out to be the best comedian of the bunch. Sigourney Weaver is also in rare form brandishing some bodacious outfits and undergarments. She is especially funny as Olga, trotting out impressive broken English and even doing some vocals accompanied by a Russian balalaika band. Ray Liotta gives a lighthearted and funny performance as a chop shop owner who can't get over his love for Maxine, even though he knows she scammed him. Jason Lee's understated nice guy portrayal serves as the perfect counterpart to Jennifer Love Hewitt's bratty vamp. The perennially cute Hewitt still can't seem to transition into grownup roles. No matter how sexy they make her up (and they do quite a good job with her considerable attributes), her pubescent mannerisms and delivery still make her come off as a teenage harpy. In her defense, this is what the role required, but it doesn't do much to move her out of her character rut.

Overall, there is a lot of good fun here that is often dissipated by puerile absurdity. Still, there are plenty of laugh-out-loud moments, mostly delivered by Weaver and Hackman, that make this a better than average comedy. I rated it 7/10. Fans who like seeing Sigourney and Jennifer in sexy outfits will not be disappointed.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":52268,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.2},"duration":"PT2H3M"}</script><metacontent="

A mother and daughter con team seduce and scam wealthy men." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0125022/","name":"Heartbreakers","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTQ2NjE3NjQzOF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwMDIwOTA0NA@@._V1_.jpg","contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Comedy","Crime","Romance"],"actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000244/","name":"Sigourney Weaver","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001349/","name":"Jennifer Love Hewitt","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000432/","name":"Gene Hackman"],"director":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0592400/","name":"David Mirkin"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0022730/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0007143/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0242743/","name":"Robert Dunn","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0345488/","name":"Paul Guay","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0563397/","name":"Stephen Mazur"],"trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Official Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2470559257","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZDNhM2Y4YmYtZmU2ZC00MmYwLWFhNTctOTVmYzNhOTExNTBhXkEyXkFqcGdeQXN3aWZ0dw@@._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZDNhM2Y4YmYtZmU2ZC00MmYwLWFhNTctOTVmYzNhOTExNTBhXkEyXkFqcGdeQXN3aWZ0dw@@._V1_.jpg","description":"A mother and daughter con team seduce and scam wealthy men.","datePublished":"2001-03-23","description":"A mother and daughter con team seduce and scam wealthy men.","keywords":"decolletage,short dress,revolver,female criminal,femme fatale","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0125022/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"FlickJunkie-2","dateCreated":"2001-11-04","inLanguage":"English","name":"Screwball comedy; Hackman steals the show","reviewBody":"This screwball comedy brings together some great dramatic actors in unaccustomed comedic roles. The results are mixed (but mostly good), with some terrific slapstick and some pure drivel. Maxine (Sigourney Weaver) and Paige (Jennifer Love Hewitt) are two very slick con artists who find rich patsies and marry them, only to divorce them for big settlements after enticing them into indiscretions. When they get nabbed by the IRS for not paying their taxes, they must score one more time to climb out of their financial mess. The target is chain smoking billionaire William B. Tensy (Gene Hackman) who is dying before our eyes of lung disease. The only question is whether Maxine can get him to propose before he keels over. Meanwhile, Paige is running her own scam on Jack (Jason Lee) who owns a bar resting on prime real estate worth $3 Million.

It is mostly pratfall humor, with lots of sight gags and general nuttiness, which is often uproariously funny. The whole idea that the diminutive Paige could have been spawned from the Amazonian Maxine is implied comedy at its finest, leading us to conclude that Paige's father could only have been a midget.

Gene Hackman completely steals the show as the wheezy billionaire. Hackman, who is one of our national treasures as a dramatic actor, shows magnificent range, and he turns out to be the best comedian of the bunch. Sigourney Weaver is also in rare form brandishing some bodacious outfits and undergarments. She is especially funny as Olga, trotting out impressive broken English and even doing some vocals accompanied by a Russian balalaika band. Ray Liotta gives a lighthearted and funny performance as a chop shop owner who can't get over his love for Maxine, even though he knows she scammed him. Jason Lee's understated nice guy portrayal serves as the perfect counterpart to Jennifer Love Hewitt's bratty vamp. The perennially cute Hewitt still can't seem to transition into grownup roles. No matter how sexy they make her up (and they do quite a good job with her considerable attributes), her pubescent mannerisms and delivery still make her come off as a teenage harpy. In her defense, this is what the role required, but it doesn't do much to move her out of her character rut.

Hackman steals the show","reviewBody":"This screwball comedy brings together some great dramatic actors in unaccustomed comedic roles. The results are mixed (but mostly good), with some terrific slapstick and some pure drivel. Maxine (Sigourney Weaver) and Paige (Jennifer Love Hewitt) are two very slick con artists who find rich patsies and marry them, only to divorce them for big settlements after enticing them into indiscretions. When they get nabbed by the IRS for not paying their taxes, they must score one more time to climb out of their financial mess. The target is chain smoking billionaire William B. Tensy (Gene Hackman) who is dying before our eyes of lung disease. The only question is whether Maxine can get him to propose before he keels over. Meanwhile, Paige is running her own scam on Jack (Jason Lee) who owns a bar resting on prime real estate worth $3 Million.

It is mostly pratfall humor, with lots of sight gags and general nuttiness, which is often uproariously funny. The whole idea that the diminutive Paige could have been spawned from the Amazonian Maxine is implied comedy at its finest, leading us to conclude that Paige's father could only have been a midget.

Gene Hackman completely steals the show as the wheezy billionaire. Hackman, who is one of our national treasures as a dramatic actor, shows magnificent range, and he turns out to be the best comedian of the bunch. Sigourney Weaver is also in rare form brandishing some bodacious outfits and undergarments. She is especially funny as Olga, trotting out impressive broken English and even doing some vocals accompanied by a Russian balalaika band. Ray Liotta gives a lighthearted and funny performance as a chop shop owner who can't get over his love for Maxine, even though he knows she scammed him. Jason Lee's understated nice guy portrayal serves as the perfect counterpart to Jennifer Love Hewitt's bratty vamp. The perennially cute Hewitt still can't seem to transition into grownup roles. No matter how sexy they make her up (and they do quite a good job with her considerable attributes), her pubescent mannerisms and delivery still make her come off as a teenage harpy. In her defense, this is what the role required, but it doesn't do much to move her out of her character rut.

Overall, there is a lot of good fun here that is often dissipated by puerile absurdity. Still, there are plenty of laugh-out-loud moments, mostly delivered by Weaver and Hackman, that make this a better than average comedy. I rated it 7/10. Fans who like seeing Sigourney and Jennifer in sexy outfits will not be disappointed.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":52268,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.2},"duration":"PT2H3M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: The Flintstones
Obitelj Kremenko
programme.desc:
The Flintstones: Directed by Brian Levant. With John Goodman, Elizabeth Perkins, Rick Moranis, Rosie O'Donnell. In a parallel modern-day Stone Age world, a working-class family, the Flintstones, are set up for an executive job. But they learn that money can't buy happiness." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0109813/","name":"The Flintstones","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYzY0ZTk4YzctNzYzNy00ZDQ0LTg2Y2ItZTQyYzQxMjQwMDc2XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNTAyODkwOQ@@._V1_.jpg","contentRating":"PG","genre":["Comedy","Family","Fantasy"],"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000422/","name":"John Goodman"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001548/","name":"Rick Moranis"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0005280/","name":"Rosie O'Donnell"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0505152/","name":"Brian Levant"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0005073/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0009119/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0024579/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0662678/","name":"Tom S. Parker"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0421084/","name":"Jim Jennewein"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0211823/","name":"Steven E. de Souza"}],"trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"The Flintstones (1994)","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1458700569","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZjQ2YWIxZDktMjkxMC00YmFkLWFkYzQtNjZiMmI5ZTgwYzUzXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZjQ2YWIxZDktMjkxMC00YmFkLWFkYzQtNjZiMmI5ZTgwYzUzXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Theatrical Trailer from Amblin"},"datePublished":"1994-05-27","description":"In a parallel modern-day Stone Age world, a working-class family, the Flintstones, are set up for an executive job. But they learn that money can't buy happiness.","keywords":"based on tv series,stone age,reboot of series,product placement,based on cartoon","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0109813/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"lukem-52760"},"dateCreated":"2019-06-30","inLanguage":"English","name":"GREAT PURE 90'S MAGICAL INNOCENT FUN.","reviewBody":"I grew up in the 90's & it was a great time & so much better than today 2019,it seemed such a fun,innocent & happier time & a great time for feelgood family films such as Casper (1995),SpaceJam (1997),Jumanji (1995),Flubber (1998),Small Soldiers (1998),ConeHeads (1993) & many many more that came out during that Awesome time. The Flintstones was a huge summertime blockbuster that's full of fun & Happy times mixed into a colourful live-action version of the classic cartoon.

I loved this movie when it came (i still do) & i remember so much merchandise & promotion for this,it was everywhere. I had action figures & fridge magnets & cups & all sorts from the movie!!! The Flintstones was huge in 1994!!! Legendary Steven Spielberg was producer so you knew the effort & budget that went into this project was huge along with the nice Spielberg feel of family & sense of wonder.

John Goodman was PERFECT as Fred Flintstone,he gave a fully fun & often touching performance & is a joy to watch. He really brought the character to life but kept the silly funny feel of fred. Legendary comic great Rick Moranis was also perfect as freds best buddy Barney Rubble & also plays his role with fun & Heart. The whole cast is great & seemed to all be having so much fun!!! Rosie O'Donnell was good fun as Betty Rubble & Elizabeth Perkins is great as Wilma Flintstone.

The music is lovely & full of Nostalgia, the production design & sets are absolutely beautiful,they created such a stunningly beautiful world for the Flintstones & it's gorgeous!!!

The Flintstones is harmless,Happy & feelgood fun for the whole family & is a great film from my childhood growing up so i hold a special little spot in my heart for this lovely little comedy.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":77117,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":4.9},"duration":"PT1H31M"}</script><metacontent="

radio","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt2967224/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"Blueghost"},"dateCreated":"2017-02-16","inLanguage":"English","name":"So-so female cop flick","reviewBody":"I'm not sure what to add here that hasn't been said already. It's just a run in the mill cop comedy, except that the police character in question happens to be a woman, and her escortee is a Latin American female.

Unlike Jerry Lewis and Christopher Hitchens I know that women can be funny. There've been lots of funny women around. And the two actresses here actually do an excellent job of acting their parts. The only problem is that the writing is tepid at best. It's not bad, but it's cliché in a late 1990s 2000-teen era sort of way.

The sexual comedy is not funny. The romantic moments aren't all that romantic. There doesn't seem to be a whole lot of development about anything other than a basic plot and an attempt to play up the cultural divide between the two female leads.

Again, not really a bad film, and technically it's "good", but I think I chuckled maybe three times. Which is too bad because I've seen both actresses in other roles, and they can make good dialogue sing. This material was essentially "by the numbers" kind of stuff. Formulaic retreaded scripts do not a good movie make. And all the A-grade talent in the world won't make up for it.

Oh well. If you need a police comedy on your TV or computer monitor, go rent the first Police Academy movie, then hop onto a game server of your choice.

See it maybe once, then pass it up if the opportunity to watch it again comes around."},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":49108,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.2},"duration":"PT1H27M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Head Over Heels
Zaljubljeni do ušiju
programme.desc: Head Over Heels: Directed by Mark Waters. With Monica Potter, Freddie Prinze Jr., Shalom Harlow, Ivana Milicevic. A young woman is attracted to a man despite her thinking she's seen him kill someone." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0192111/","name":"Head Over Heels","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZTdhNzk1ZDctMTQyMi00ZmYwLWFjMWQtOTM3YjA4OTc4ZDZmXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNjU0NTI0Nw@@._V1_.jpg","contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Comedy","Mystery","Romance"],"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0005321/","name":"Monica Potter"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0005327/","name":"Freddie Prinze Jr."},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0363371/","name":"Shalom Harlow"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0914132/","name":"Mark Waters"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0005073/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0033486/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0833828/","name":"John J. Strauss"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0214036/","name":"Ed Decter"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0452235/","name":"David Kidd"}],"trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Head Over Heels","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi3568042265","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMzQ1OWE4ZjktZjIwNi00OTE3LWE4NGMtYjM2M2I4ZGI2OWI1XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMzQ1OWE4ZjktZjIwNi00OTE3LWE4NGMtYjM2M2I4ZGI2OWI1XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Home Video Trailer from Universal Studios Home Entertainment"},"datePublished":"2001-04-18","description":"A young woman is attracted to a man despite her thinking she's seen him kill someone.","keywords":"murder witness,apartment building,art restoration,apartment,binoculars","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0192111/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"Mirax"},"dateCreated":"2001-08-11","inLanguage":"English","name":"Incredibly funny if not taken too seriously","reviewBody":"I'll admit it: it's utterly embarrassing to watch this movie with another human being. I was embarrassed when I laughed uncontrollably at things numerous reviews had told me were idiotic humor. Well, this movie is idiotic. It's also adorable romantic comedy, with a funny and somewhat original premise . . . at least, it's cobbled together from original premises, like the "Rear Window" setup where Amanda thinks she witnesses her obsession across the street, Jim, murdering someone. Freddie Prinze Jr is completely irresistible, and Monica Potter's somewhat one-note nice-girl cuteness is made palatable by the insanity of her four supermodel roommates and her practical lesbian friend. Watch this, laugh hard and don't be embarrassed, because this movie, even at its most poorly scripted moments, is earnestly trying to make you laugh, unlike most of today's prefab romantic comedies, whose earnestness is sheer manipulation. Plus, only a small percentage of those have Freddie in them."},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":13985,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.5},"duration":"PT1H26M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Zaljubljeni do ušiju
programme.desc: Amanda Pierce (Monica Potter) je obična djevojka iz mirnoga gradića u Iowi, koja radi kao restauratorica renesansnih slika ... Amanda Pierce je obična djevojka iz mirnoga gradića u Iowi, koja radi kao restauratorica renesansnih slika u njujorškom muzeju Metropolitan. Upravo je izašla iz još jedne frustrirajuće ljubavne veze, nakon što je svoga dečka pronašla u krevetu s drugom djevojkom. Seli se u novi stan, koji dijeli s četiri zgodne i simpatične, mada pomalo plitke manekenke. U zgradi upozna Jima Winstona, u kojega se s vremenom zaljubljuje, ali se boji napraviti prvi korak, kako kasnije u budućnosti ne bi opet bila povrijedjena. Jedne noći, kroz prozor vidi Jima kako u svome stanu ubija neznanu ženu, pa zajedno sa svojim cimericama odluči izvidjeti što se doista dogodilo.

programme.title: Broken Flowers
Slomljeno cvijeće
programme.desc:
Broken Flowers: Directed by Jim Jarmusch. With Bill Murray, Julie Delpy, Heather Simms, Brea Frazier. As the extremely withdrawn Don Johnston is dumped by his latest woman, he receives an anonymous letter from a former lover informing him that he has a son who may be looking for him. A freelance sleuth neighbor moves Don to embark on a cross-country search for his old flames in search of answers." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0412019/","name":"Broken Flowers","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTQ4OTk1MTYxM15BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwMTYwNjAzMQ@@._V1_.jpg","contentRating":"R","genre":["Comedy","Drama","Mystery"],"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000195/","name":"Bill Murray"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001448/","name":"Jessica Lange"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000232/","name":"Sharon Stone"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000464/","name":"Jim Jarmusch"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0042399/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0248275/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0024879/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000464/","name":"Jim Jarmusch"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2260851/","name":"Bill Raden"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0238138/","name":"Sara Driver"}],"trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Broken Flowers","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi700186905","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMmJkYTcxNGEtOGM3Zi00OGNkLWFkNjItZDM3ODlhNTk4MzU0XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMmJkYTcxNGEtOGM3Zi00OGNkLWFkNjItZDM3ODlhNTk4MzU0XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Trailer 1"},"datePublished":"2005-08-26","description":"As the extremely withdrawn Don Johnston is dumped by his latest woman, he receives an anonymous letter from a former lover informing him that he has a son who may be looking for him. A freelance sleuth neighbor moves Don to embark on","keywords":"illegitimate son,casual sex,single parent,mistress,hippie chick","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0412019/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"drjimmycooper"},"dateCreated":"2005-06-04","inLanguage":"English","name":"Wonderfully unique and charming (but perhaps too spare)","reviewBody":"I just saw this at a press screening. It's very smart, well-made and entertaining, directed with sure-handed control, full of quirky, funny moments and superb acting. The film pretty much avoids clichés, although it does rely a bit on the familiar "Aren't Middle-Americans quirky?" idea for its humor. But Jarmusch never goes too far with this, his restraint keeping the film propelled from beginning to end.

The only weakness for me is rooted in the film's strength: I feel like there's not quite enough here. 

Murray's character is beleaguered and despondent, Murray plays him with perfect subtlety. This is fun and fascinating to watch; I found myself hanging onto every little expression on Murray's face. But, the combination of his passive, muted performance and the spare storytelling left me wanting more. It just doesn't have as much impact as I feel it could have. So, yes, it's wonderful minimalism, but perhaps a bit too slight of a movie to have any lasting resonance.

Bill Murray has added another very good performance to his career, and Jim Jarmusch has made another compact little gem (unlike some of his more recent films). Unique and entertaining. Definitely worth seeing.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":99453,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.2},"duration":"PT1H46M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Il mestiere delle armi
Profesija: Oružje
programme.desc: Il mestiere delle armi: Directed by Ermanno Olmi. With Christo Jivkov, Sergio Grammatico, Dimitar Rachkov, Fabio Giubbani. The history of the first victim of modern artillery and its moving agony, amidst conspiracies and betrayals of the powerful. Life and death of Giovanni De' Medici, a young brave captain in the war of Charles V against the Pope, in the first half of 1500." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0245276/","name":"Il mestiere delle armi","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNzYxNWJhYzQtNmViZi00MjRlLTg4ZGYtNDUyM2I1Mzc3ODliXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNTA0OTU0OTQ@._V1_.jpg","contentRating":"Not Rated","genre":["Drama","History","War"],"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0998941/","name":"Christo Jivkov"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0973217/","name":"Sergio Grammatico"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0973690/","name":"Dimitar Rachkov"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0647438/","name":"Ermanno Olmi"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0017905/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0066197/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0047476/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0647438/","name":"Ermanno Olmi"}],"datePublished":"2001-05-11","description":"The history of the first victim of modern artillery and its moving agony, amidst conspiracies and betrayals of the powerful. Life and death of Giovanni De' Medici, a young brave captain in the war of Charles V against the Pope, in th","keywords":"1500s,winter,northern italy,italy,pope","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0245276/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"Riders-In-The-Sky"},"dateCreated":"2006-08-05","inLanguage":"English","name":"An artistic movie, not an action movie","reviewBody":"It is not an "easy" film. If you are searching for an adventure film, or a "kolossal", you don't find it here. But this is a beautiful movie by the artistic side, you need to watch it with calm and patience, like you have to watch a picture of a famous painter. The plot is carried out like touches of brush, the characters are "painted" over a background of ethereal landscapes, nearly soft. So, why my vote is only a 7/10? This is just because the movie is not easy, perhaps too slow for a "normal" vision. After all when I watch a movie, often, specially when I'm tired at the end of a hard day, I need to relax myself, while this movie needs much attention. I don't think you can watch it without a little of concentration, at least the first time. Like you look at a painting.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":1432,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7},"duration":"PT1H45M"}</script><metacontent="

A red-colored violin inspires passion, making its way through three centuries over several owners and countries, eventually ending up at an auction where it may find a new owner." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0120802/","name":"Le violon rouge","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYmZiMGI1ZWQtM2ZiOS00YWQ0LWEwYzMtODhhYTMwMzM5MjU4XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTA0MjU0Ng@@._V1_.jpg","contentRating":"R","genre":["Drama","Music","Mystery"],"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0147605/","name":"Carlo Cecchi"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0081175/","name":"Jean-Luc Bideau"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0464855/","name":"Christoph Koncz"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0320660/","name":"François Girard"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0010810/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0025719/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0042275/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001528/","name":"Don McKellar"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0320660/","name":"François Girard"}],"datePublished":"1998-11-13","description":"A red-colored violin inspires passion, making its way through three centuries over several owners and countries, eventually ending up at an auction where it may find a new owner.","keywords":"violin,auction,period drama,montreal,violinist","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0120802/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"rudat"},"dateCreated":"2001-02-04","inLanguage":"English","name":"Unforgettable experience","reviewBody":"After watching too many would-be "great pieces" lately that are enticing you from TV commercials, leaving you (or me, I should say) disappointed most of the time, "The Red Violin" is a gem among all these fleeting flicks or time-wasters. Recommended by a good friend I went to see this piece and frankly, I came out of the theater speechless! I was overwhelmed, enriched as well as happy that I finally, in years, got to see something that's well worth while.

From the story, costumes, cinematography, acting and finally its greatest actor -the superb music- all absolutely flawless! S.L.Jackson acts at his best, his performance is unforgettable and I am sure one of his own most favourite; I can tell. I was estatic to see J.Corigliano win the Oscar for the best score, and saddened at the fact that the whole movie wasn't nominated for even more Oscars - are they blind in that Academy or what?! Now that's a shame but you know what I don't care what the Academy has to say, important is my subjective feeling and this movie made my day, and days to come.

I couldn't wait to get hold of both, the video and the sound track, and I never seem to get tired watching or hearing that beauty all over again. And believe it or not, that ingenious soundtrack can be so erotic at times that if I may give a little advice to all these men out there seeking to entice and seduce their partners - hey, this might be the way to go - worked for me (and her!)!!!

Anyways, I'd like to recommend this movie to everybody with an open heart and mind, I guarantee satisfaction and enrichment in every possible way. And lastly let me bestow my gratitude and thanks to the very director F.Girard for enlightening my spirit, my heart and my soul with his vision of a truly quality story that I can never forget."},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":31945,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.6},"duration":"PT2H10M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.desc: The Tomb of Ligeia: Directed by Roger Corman. With Vincent Price, Elizabeth Shepherd, John Westbrook, Derek Francis. A man's obsession with his dead wife drives a wedge between him and his new bride." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0059821/","name":"The Tomb of Ligeia","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNjgxNTM0Nzk0OV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwMTgyMTM4NA@@._V1_.jpg","contentRating":"Not Rated","genre":["Drama","Horror","Thriller"],"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001637/","name":"Vincent Price"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0791774/","name":"Elizabeth Shepherd"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0922462/","name":"John Westbrook"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000339/","name":"Roger Corman"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0108828/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000590/","name":"Edgar Allan Poe"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001801/","name":"Robert Towne"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0562577/","name":"Paul Mayersberg"}],"datePublished":"1965-01-20","description":"A man's obsession with his dead wife drives a wedge between him and his new bride.","keywords":"19th century,black cat,tombstone,secret passage,riding accident","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0059821/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"capkronos"},"dateCreated":"2003-12-30","inLanguage":"English","name":"Corman finally brings a Poe film outdoors.","reviewBody":"Well, at least for a little while! His last of eight Poe films as director is (loosely) based on the Poe work of the same name and is a solid metaphorical ghost story. Lady Rowena (the wonderful Elizabeth Shepherd) falls in love with Verden Fell (Vincent Price) despite his strange behavior and questionable past. Soon after their marriage, he starts disappearing, she's menaced by that old Poe stand-by (the evil black cat) and plagued by horrific nightmares involving Verden's deceased former wife Ligeia (also played by Shepherd), whose ghost seems intent on ruining the union. Price, in top hat and strange sunglasses in many scenes (his vision being "dangerously acute"), seems a bit too old for the role, but still manages to come through with an effective performance. Corman has always been underrated for effectively capturing period detail on a limited budget and it's his keen eye for the crumbling ruins, lush green countrysides, oceanfronts and shadowy castle corridors that make much of this film work. Screenplay by future Oscar-winner Robert Towne (CHINATOWN). LIGEIA was Corman's last horror film as director until 1990's FRANKENSTEIN UNBOUND.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":5545,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.5},"duration":"PT1H22M"}</script><metacontent="

A European prince terrorizes the local peasantry while using his castle as a refuge against the "Red Death" plague that stalks the land." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0058333/","name":"The Masque of the Red Death","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNjFjYmZmZDctZWUzZS00ZDY2LWE1MGMtMTIwMDAxODgzN2ZhXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTQxNzMzNDI@._V1_.jpg","contentRating":"Not Rated","genre":["Horror"],"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001637/","name":"Vincent Price"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0183764/","name":"Hazel Court"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0038870/","name":"Jane Asher"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000339/","name":"Roger Corman"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0108828/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0064579/","name":"Charles Beaumont"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0132790/","name":"R. Wright Campbell"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000590/","name":"Edgar Allan Poe"}],"trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Official Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi4186292505","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMWM4MjFhOGUtNDU0MC00YzFlLWExZDQtZDMwZWE4Njg0N2JkXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMWM4MjFhOGUtNDU0MC00YzFlLWExZDQtZDMwZWE4Njg0N2JkXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","description":"A European prince terrorizes the local peasantry while using his castle as a refuge against the "Red Death" plague that stalks the land."},"datePublished":"1964-10-30","description":"A European prince terrorizes the local peasantry while using his castle as a refuge against the "Red Death" plague that stalks the land.","keywords":"shuffling cards,rose,killed by sword,village,castle","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0058333/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"BaronBl00d"},"dateCreated":"1999-09-26","inLanguage":"English","name":"Price at his Most Wicked!","reviewBody":"Roger Corman has done an outstanding job with this film, possibly the best of his Poe adaptations. Although the film really is an incorporation of two Poe stories....The Masque of the Red Death and Hop-Frog...it is an excellent, atmospheric, quality piece of entertainment. At the core of the film's strength are the performance of Price as the evil, malignant, malicious Prince Prospero, follower of the devil and cruel sovereign of an area plagued with a all-consuming Red Death, and the fabulous period sets and costumes, many borrowed from the film Beckett. Price is at his best, and his turn as Prospero easily ranks as his most sinister and wicked performance(closely running against his portrayal of a witch hunter in The Conquerer Worm). Vincent Price blends outrageous showmanship with intricate subtleties of a man reasoning why he is what he is. The dialogue certainly is more important than the action in the story...a reason why some viewers(younger ones more than likely) will find film a bit tiresome. The sets and costumes are just gorgeous and the film looks like the most lavish ever made by Corman and company. A true modern masterpiece of the horror cinema!"},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":13129,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7},"duration":"PT1H29M"}</script><metacontent="

Although the film really is an incorporation of two Poe stories....The Masque of the Red Death and Hop-Frog...it is an excellent, atmospheric, quality piece of entertainment. At the core of the film's strength are the performance of Price as the evil, malignant, malicious Prince Prospero, follower of the devil and cruel sovereign of an area plagued with a all-consuming Red Death, and the fabulous period sets and costumes, many borrowed from the film Beckett. Price is at his best, and his turn as Prospero easily ranks as his most sinister and wicked performance(closely running against his portrayal of a witch hunter in The Conquerer Worm). programme.title: Ljubav i mržnja
programme.desc: Lazarevići su članovi beogradskog "visokog društva" i predstavljaju osim svojih indvidualnostima ono što takvo društvo kod nas podrazumijeva: ljubav, spletke, sreću, nevolje, generacijske sukobe... Lazarevići su članovi beogradskog "visokog društva" i predstavljaju osim svojih indvidualnostima ono što takvo društvo kod nas podrazumijeva: ljubav, spletke, sreću, nevolje, generacijske sukobe, mržnju. Sve ovo je ipak protkano životom i nenametljivim humorom uz blagu ironiju. Serija "Ljubav i mržnja" zamišljena je u najboljem maniru američke obiteljske serije, sa naizgled definiranim ali zamršenim i nedpredvidivim odnosima između njenih aktera. Tako se ova serija sa svim svojim zavrzlamama kako novac nije garancija za zdravlje i sreću, ali da ga je vrlo lijepo imati i prije svega prikazivati. Cilj serije je da zabavi da gledatelje veže za svoj sadržaj i da prije svega traje.

programme.title: Naša mala redakcija
programme.desc: Kako izgleda radni dan u jednoj novinskoj redakciji? Zgode i nezgode zaposlenih u novinskoj redakciji "Panorama". Kako izgleda radni dan u jednoj novinskoj redakciji? Zgode i nezgode zaposlenih u novinskoj redakciji "Panorama".

programme.title: Kafanica blizu SiS-a
programme.desc: Već znamo da je "Agencija za sve i svašta" vlasotinačko preduzeće koje rešava sve probleme svojih klijenata. Već znamo da je "Agencija za sve i svašta" vlasotinačko preduzeće koje rešava sve probleme svojih klijenata. Osnivač i vlasnik firme je Spiridon Don Karamarković, nekadašnji pripadnik Legije stranaca, ekspert za sva pitanja i najškrtiji gazda na svetu. Deda mu je rekao da svaki uspešan Srbin mora da ima kafanu i on je ove godine osnovao svoju. Poslove oko kafane poverio je misterioznoj Madam Žaklini koja je naše gore list, ali je ugostiteljsko znanje sticala u Parizu.

programme.title: M(j)ešoviti brak
programme.desc: Serija "M(j)ešoviti brak" snimljena je na osnovu istoimene pozorišne predstave koja spada među najgledanije poslednjih godina. Serija "M(j)ešoviti brak" snimljena je na osnovu istoimene pozorišne predstave koja spada među najgledanije poslednjih godina. Naravno, dodati su novi likovi, proširena je priča, a gastarbajterska porodica Čađenovic vratila se u novu državu, Srbiju i Crnu Goru. Čuli su za promene, pa su odlučili da posle više godina boravka u Lucernu, u Švajcarskoj, teško zarađene devize ulože u bisnis u Beogradu. Sasvim slucajno, prvi kadrovi ove serije snimljeni su u državi koja se zvala Jugoslavija, a prva epizoda završena je u državi, koja se poput ovog mešovitog braka Crnogorca i Srpkinje, zove Srbija i Crna Gora.

programme.title: Vila Marija
programme.desc: Porodici Jurak nacionalizovan je veći deo imovine nakon Drugog svetskog rata, ali svejedno nisu ostali siromašni. Stanuju u dobrom zagrebačkom kvartu. Tomislav Jurak (Žarko Radić) je... Porodici Jurak nacionalizovan je veći deo imovine nakon Drugog svetskog rata, ali svejedno nisu ostali siromašni. Stanuju u dobrom zagrebačkom kvartu. Tomislav Jurak (Žarko Radić) je pedesetogodišnjak, vodi porodični biznis koji uključuje lanac restorana i hotel u centru grada, koji je počeo da gradi još u vreme socijalizma, ali ga je u vlasništvo preuzeo tokom privatizacije devedesetih novcem svoje tete Mitzy. Njegova žena Ana Jurak (Ksenija Pajić), u ranim četrdesetim, rodila mu je dvoje dece- Ivana i Doru. Ana je napustila studije prava kad ga je upoznala i posvetila se brizi o porodici i uz pomoć kućne pomoćnice, brizi o samoj sebi-shopping, bazen i tračanje, omiljene su joj obaveze. Kako god bilo, ona je u svakom slučaju temelj familije. Ćerka Dora (Jelena Veljača) ima 20 godina i studira ekonomiju. Otac je obožava i ne prihvata činjenicu da je već odavno došla u godine da ima dečka i svoju intimu. Razmažena tatina kćer. Ivan (Mislav Čavajda) radi s ocem u firmi. Zgodan zagrebački dečko, dvadesetpetogodišnjak, ali neodgovoran, sklon porocima, ukratko, loš karakter lepog lica. S druge strane, nalazi se porodica bankara Maksa Lovreka (Ante Čedo Martinić), koji Jurakovoj firmi daje veliki kredit za preuzimanje malotrgovinskog lanca. On i Tomislav Jurak (ne)prijatelji su još od falultetskih dana. Uz posao, Jurakovi i Lovrekovi povezani su i privatno, a razdoblje prividnog prijateljstva s početka priče ubrzo prerasta u suparništvo. Max Lovrek oženjen je Vesnom Lovrek (Barbara Vicković), ženom sumnjivog karaktera, koja je pritom Maksu neverna. Bankar Lovrek iz prvog braka ima sina Svena (Sven Madžarević), 2o godišnjaka, prilično povučenog, skromnog dečka. Maks kuje zaveru protiv Juraka s Jurakovim ambicioznim sinom Ivanom. Treća glavna ekipa su bolesna majka Dunja (Nada Gačešić Livaković) i njen sin Luka (Damir Markovina), pametan i obrazovan mladić koji neumorno radi kod Jurakovih, ali ne razume da ga oni iskorištavaju. Ima i razloga za slepilo: voli Jurakovu ćerku, Doru. Njihovu vezu Tomislav Jurak nikad ne bi dopustio...

programme.title: Ljubav i mržnja
programme.desc: Lazarevići su članovi beogradskog "visokog društva" i predstavljaju osim svojih indvidualnostima ono što takvo društvo kod nas podrazumijeva: ljubav, spletke, sreću, nevolje, generacijske sukobe... Lazarevići su članovi beogradskog "visokog društva" i predstavljaju osim svojih indvidualnostima ono što takvo društvo kod nas podrazumijeva: ljubav, spletke, sreću, nevolje, generacijske sukobe, mržnju. Sve ovo je ipak protkano životom i nenametljivim humorom uz blagu ironiju. Serija "Ljubav i mržnja" zamišljena je u najboljem maniru američke obiteljske serije, sa naizgled definiranim ali zamršenim i nedpredvidivim odnosima između njenih aktera. Tako se ova serija sa svim svojim zavrzlamama kako novac nije garancija za zdravlje i sreću, ali da ga je vrlo lijepo imati i prije svega prikazivati. Cilj serije je da zabavi da gledatelje veže za svoj sadržaj i da prije svega traje.

programme.title: Naša mala redakcija
programme.desc: U ovoj humorističkoj seriji, pratimo zgode i nezgode zaposlenih u jednoj novinskoj redakciji. U ovoj humorističkoj seriji, pratimo zgode i nezgode zaposlenih u jednoj novinskoj redakciji.

programme.title: Kafanica blizu SiS-a
programme.desc: Domaća serija Kafanica blizu SIS-a je humoristička serija koja govori o jednoj firmi iz Vlasotinaca, koja se bavi rešavanjem raznih problema koje klijenti svakodnevno imaju. Domaća serija Kafanica blizu SIS-a je humoristička serija koja govori o jednoj firmi iz Vlasotinaca, koja se bavi rešavanjem raznih problema koje klijenti svakodnevno imaju. Gazda firme je cicija i na sve načine izbegava troši pare. Gazda je Spiridon Don Karamarković, čija je desna ruka sestrić Mulja, a tu je i pomoćnica Roza, koja je glavna kada Spiridona nema.

programme.title: Vila Marija
programme.desc: Porodici Jurak nacionalizovan je veći deo imovine nakon Drugog svetskog rata, ali svejedno nisu ostali siromašni. Stanuju u dobrom zagrebačkom kvartu. Tomislav Jurak (Žarko Radić) je... Porodici Jurak nacionalizovan je veći deo imovine nakon Drugog svetskog rata, ali svejedno nisu ostali siromašni. Stanuju u dobrom zagrebačkom kvartu. Tomislav Jurak (Žarko Radić) je pedesetogodišnjak, vodi porodični biznis koji uključuje lanac restorana i hotel u centru grada, koji je počeo da gradi još u vreme socijalizma, ali ga je u vlasništvo preuzeo tokom privatizacije devedesetih novcem svoje tete Mitzy. Njegova žena Ana Jurak (Ksenija Pajić), u ranim četrdesetim, rodila mu je dvoje dece- Ivana i Doru. Ana je napustila studije prava kad ga je upoznala i posvetila se brizi o porodici i uz pomoć kućne pomoćnice, brizi o samoj sebi-shopping, bazen i tračanje, omiljene su joj obaveze. Kako god bilo, ona je u svakom slučaju temelj familije. Ćerka Dora (Jelena Veljača) ima 20 godina i studira ekonomiju. Otac je obožava i ne prihvata činjenicu da je već odavno došla u godine da ima dečka i svoju intimu. Razmažena tatina kćer. Ivan (Mislav Čavajda) radi s ocem u firmi. Zgodan zagrebački dečko, dvadesetpetogodišnjak, ali neodgovoran, sklon porocima, ukratko, loš karakter lepog lica. S druge strane, nalazi se porodica bankara Maksa Lovreka (Ante Čedo Martinić), koji Jurakovoj firmi daje veliki kredit za preuzimanje malotrgovinskog lanca. On i Tomislav Jurak (ne)prijatelji su još od falultetskih dana. Uz posao, Jurakovi i Lovrekovi povezani su i privatno, a razdoblje prividnog prijateljstva s početka priče ubrzo prerasta u suparništvo. Max Lovrek oženjen je Vesnom Lovrek (Barbara Vicković), ženom sumnjivog karaktera, koja je pritom Maksu neverna. Bankar Lovrek iz prvog braka ima sina Svena (Sven Madžarević), 2o godišnjaka, prilično povučenog, skromnog dečka. Maks kuje zaveru protiv Juraka s Jurakovim ambicioznim sinom Ivanom. Treća glavna ekipa su bolesna majka Dunja (Nada Gačešić Livaković) i njen sin Luka (Damir Markovina), pametan i obrazovan mladić koji neumorno radi kod Jurakovih, ali ne razume da ga oni iskorištavaju. Ima i razloga za slepilo: voli Jurakovu ćerku, Doru. Njihovu vezu Tomislav Jurak nikad ne bi dopustio...

programme.title: Ljubav i mržnja
programme.desc: Lazarevići su članovi beogradskog "visokog društva" i predstavljaju osim svojih indvidualnostima ono što takvo društvo kod nas podrazumijeva: ljubav, spletke, sreću, nevolje, generacijske sukobe... Lazarevići su članovi beogradskog "visokog društva" i predstavljaju osim svojih indvidualnostima ono što takvo društvo kod nas podrazumijeva: ljubav, spletke, sreću, nevolje, generacijske sukobe, mržnju. Sve ovo je ipak protkano životom i nenametljivim humorom uz blagu ironiju. Serija "Ljubav i mržnja" zamišljena je u najboljem maniru američke obiteljske serije, sa naizgled definiranim ali zamršenim i nedpredvidivim odnosima između njenih aktera. Tako se ova serija sa svim svojim zavrzlamama kako novac nije garancija za zdravlje i sreću, ali da ga je vrlo lijepo imati i prije svega prikazivati. Cilj serije je da zabavi da gledatelje veže za svoj sadržaj i da prije svega traje.

programme.title: Naša mala redakcija
programme.desc: Kako izgleda radni dan u jednoj novinskoj redakciji? Zgode i nezgode zaposlenih u novinskoj redakciji "Panorama". Kako izgleda radni dan u jednoj novinskoj redakciji? Zgode i nezgode zaposlenih u novinskoj redakciji "Panorama".

programme.title: Kafanica blizu SiS-a
programme.desc: Već znamo da je "Agencija za sve i svašta" vlasotinačko preduzeće koje rešava sve probleme svojih klijenata. Već znamo da je "Agencija za sve i svašta" vlasotinačko preduzeće koje rešava sve probleme svojih klijenata. Osnivač i vlasnik firme je Spiridon Don Karamarković, nekadašnji pripadnik Legije stranaca, ekspert za sva pitanja i najškrtiji gazda na svetu. Deda mu je rekao da svaki uspešan Srbin mora da ima kafanu i on je ove godine osnovao svoju. Poslove oko kafane poverio je misterioznoj Madam Žaklini koja je naše gore list, ali je ugostiteljsko znanje sticala u Parizu.

programme.title: M(j)ešoviti brak
programme.desc: Serija "M(j)ešoviti brak" snimljena je na osnovu istoimene pozorišne predstave koja spada među najgledanije poslednjih godina. Serija "M(j)ešoviti brak" snimljena je na osnovu istoimene pozorišne predstave koja spada među najgledanije poslednjih godina. Naravno, dodati su novi likovi, proširena je priča, a gastarbajterska porodica Čađenovic vratila se u novu državu, Srbiju i Crnu Goru. Čuli su za promene, pa su odlučili da posle više godina boravka u Lucernu, u Švajcarskoj, teško zarađene devize ulože u bisnis u Beogradu. Sasvim slucajno, prvi kadrovi ove serije snimljeni su u državi koja se zvala Jugoslavija, a prva epizoda završena je u državi, koja se poput ovog mešovitog braka Crnogorca i Srpkinje, zove Srbija i Crna Gora.

credits.actor: Danijela Vranješ, Ana Stefanović, Ivana Mihić, Slobodan Stefanović, Goran Jevtić

programme.title: Zvezdara
programme.desc: Serija "Zvezdara ", priča koja prati tri beogradske obitelji, koja je okupila vrsnu ekipu glumaca, čak njih šezdeset. Drama o suvremenoj svakodnevici, prikazanoj na dramski i komičan način. Serija "Zvezdara ", priča koja prati tri beogradske obitelji, koja je okupila vrsnu ekipu glumaca, čak njih šezdeset. Drama o suvremenoj svakodnevici, prikazanoj na dramski i komičan način, sa svim problemima i dešavanjima običnih ljudi, okosnica je ovog serijskog programa.
